user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BSP_Lock_Impl:
```c
void OS_BSP_Lock_Impl(void)
{
    int status;

    status = pthread_mutex_lock(&OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.AccessMutex);
    if (status < 0)
    {
        BSP_DEBUG("pthread_mutex_lock: %s\n", strerror(status));
    }
    else
    {
        /*
         * Temporarily Disable/Defer thread cancellation.
         * Note that OS_BSP_ConsoleOutput_Impl() calls write() which is a cancellation point.
         * So if this calling task is canceled, it risks leaving the BSP locked.
         */
        pthread_setcancelstate(PTHREAD_CANCEL_DISABLE, &OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.AccessCancelState);
    }
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other parts of the function do not appear to contain unreachable code and therefore do not need investigation for Rule 2.1: the declaration of 'int status;' is just a variable definition; the call 'status = pthread_mutex_lock(&OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.AccessMutex);' is an executed statement whose result determines control flow; the else branch (including the comment and the call to pthread_setcancelstate) is reachable as the alternative control path; there are no early returns, goto jumps, or conditional compilation blocks in this fragment that would create other unreachable sections. Thus no additional code fragments in this function appear to be unreachable.
